sections.title: Fixed braces with clinician-led planning
sections.body: Orthodontic treatment improves alignment and bite by moving teeth in planned, controlled steps. Options can include clear aligners or fixed braces, depending on the complexity of movement needed and the stability of the bite. We begin with diagnosis: assessing gum health, tooth wear, jaw symptoms and how your teeth meet, then using digital scans (and X-rays where appropriate) to plan movement and discuss what’s realistic. Orthodontics can be valuable on its own or as preparation for restorative work such as bonding, crowns or veneers. We’ll explain timelines, retention, and the checks needed to keep treatment on track safely.
bullets: Focus on fixed braces, not Invisalign

sections.title: Steady tooth movement guided by in-clinic adjustments
sections.body: Fixed braces use brackets and wires to move teeth gradually. Each adjustment is planned in practice so you know what to expect, how to care for your braces, and when to return for reviews, while we outline how whitening (/treatments/teeth-whitening) or veneers (/treatments/veneers) can refine the smile once teeth are stable.

faqs.question: How long do fixed braces take?
faqs.answer: Treatment length depends on your bite and the amount of movement needed. We share a projected range at your consultation and keep you updated at reviews.

faqs.question: Are there less visible options?
faqs.answer: Ceramic brackets may be suitable for a lower-visual look. We’ll explain pros, limitations, and whether they fit your plan.

faqs.question: Do braces hurt?
faqs.answer: You may feel tightness or rubbing after fittings or adjustments. Discomfort usually eases in a few days; we’ll share tips to stay comfortable.

faqs.question: Can I eat normally?
faqs.answer: You can enjoy most foods, but we’ll advise on harder or sticky items that could damage brackets or wires. Softer options help right after adjustments.

faqs.question: How much do braces cost?
faqs.answer: Fees vary with complexity, brace type, and visit frequency. We provide a clear estimate and payment options after assessing your case.

faqs.question: Why choose braces instead of aligners?
faqs.answer: Fixed braces give the clinician more direct control over certain movements and don’t rely on long wear times. We’ll recommend the approach that best suits your teeth and lifestyle.

faqs.question: What if a bracket or wire comes loose?
faqs.answer: Contact the clinic promptly. We’ll schedule a fix and guide you on temporary steps to stay comfortable until the visit.

faqs.question: Will I need retainers?
faqs.answer: Yes. Retainers help keep your teeth stable after movement. We agree a retention plan and review it with you before braces come off.
